signature.pp: {X Y : Type} (f : X → Y) : Prop

ref.pp:
/-- Definition 11.2.1 -/
abbrev Constant {X Y : Type} (f : X → Y) : Prop :=
  ∃ c, ∀ x, f x = c

signature.pp: {X Y : Type} [hY : Nonempty Y] (f : X → Y) : Y

ref.pp:
noncomputable abbrev constant_value {X Y : Type} [hY : Nonempty Y] (f : X → Y) : Y :=
  if h : Constant f then h.choose else hY.some

signature.pp: {X Y : Type} {f : X → Y} [Nonempty Y] (h : Constant f) (x : X) : f x = constant_value f

ref.pp:
theorem eq {X Y : Type} {f : X → Y} [Nonempty Y] (h : Constant f) (x : X) : f x = constant_value f := by
  simp [constant_value, h]; apply h.choose_spec

signature.pp: {X Y : Type} {f : X → Y} {c : Y} (h : ∀ x, f x = c) : Constant f

ref.pp: theorem of_const {X Y : Type} {f : X → Y} {c : Y} (h : ∀ x, f x = c) : Constant f := by use c

signature.pp: {X Y : Type} {f : X → Y} [hX : Nonempty X] [Nonempty Y] {c : Y} (h : ∀ x, f x = c) : constant_value f = c

ref.pp:
theorem const_eq {X Y : Type} {f : X → Y} [hX : Nonempty X] [Nonempty Y] {c : Y} (h : ∀ x, f x = c) :
    constant_value f = c := by rw [← eq (of_const h) hX.some, h hX.some]

signature.pp: {X Y : Type} [hs : Subsingleton X] [hY : Nonempty Y] {f : X → Y} : Constant f

ref.pp:
theorem of_subsingleton {X Y : Type} [hs : Subsingleton X] [hY : Nonempty Y] {f : X → Y} : Constant f :=
  by
  by_cases h : Nonempty X
  . use f h.some; intros; congr; exact hs.elim _ h.some
  simp at h; exact ⟨hY.some, h.elim⟩

signature.pp: (f : ℝ → ℝ) (X : Set ℝ) : Prop

ref.pp:
abbrev ConstantOn (f : ℝ → ℝ) (X : Set ℝ) : Prop :=
  Constant (fun x : X ↦ f ↑x)

signature.pp: (f : ℝ → ℝ) (X : Set ℝ) : ℝ

ref.pp:
noncomputable abbrev constant_value_on (f : ℝ → ℝ) (X : Set ℝ) : ℝ :=
  constant_value (fun x : X ↦ f ↑x)

signature.pp: {f : ℝ → ℝ} {X : Set ℝ} (h : ConstantOn f X) {x : ℝ} (hx : x ∈ X) : f x = constant_value_on f X

ref.pp:
theorem eq {f : ℝ → ℝ} {X : Set ℝ} (h : ConstantOn f X) {x : ℝ} (hx : x ∈ X) : f x = constant_value_on f X := by
  convert Constant.eq h ⟨_, hx⟩

signature.pp: {f : ℝ → ℝ} {X : Set ℝ} {c : ℝ} (h : ∀ x ∈ X, f x = c) : ConstantOn f X

ref.pp:
theorem of_const {f : ℝ → ℝ} {X : Set ℝ} {c : ℝ} (h : ∀ x ∈ X, f x = c) : ConstantOn f X :=
  ⟨c, by grind⟩

signature.pp: (c : ℝ) (X : Set ℝ) : ConstantOn (fun _ ↦ c) X

ref.pp:
theorem of_const' (c : ℝ) (X : Set ℝ) : ConstantOn (fun _ ↦ c) X :=
  of_const (c := c) (by simp)

signature.pp: {f : ℝ → ℝ} {X : Set ℝ} (hX : X.Nonempty) {c : ℝ} (h : ∀ x ∈ X, f x = c) : constant_value_on f X = c

ref.pp:
theorem const_eq {f : ℝ → ℝ} {X : Set ℝ} (hX : X.Nonempty) {c : ℝ} (h : ∀ x ∈ X, f x = c) : constant_value_on f X = c :=
  by rw [← eq (of_const h) hX.some_mem, h _ hX.some_mem]

signature.pp: {f g : ℝ → ℝ} {X : Set ℝ} (h : ∀ x ∈ X, f x = g x) : ConstantOn f X ↔ ConstantOn g X

ref.pp:
theorem congr {f g : ℝ → ℝ} {X : Set ℝ} (h : ∀ x ∈ X, f x = g x) : ConstantOn f X ↔ ConstantOn g X := by
  simp_rw [ConstantOn, iff_iff_eq]; congr; grind

signature.pp: {f g : ℝ → ℝ} {X : Set ℝ} (hf : ConstantOn f X) (h : ∀ x ∈ X, f x = g x) : ConstantOn g X

ref.pp:
theorem congr' {f g : ℝ → ℝ} {X : Set ℝ} (hf : ConstantOn f X) (h : ∀ x ∈ X, f x = g x) : ConstantOn g X :=
  (congr h).mp hf

signature.pp: {f : ℝ → ℝ} {X : Set ℝ} [Subsingleton X] : ConstantOn f X

ref.pp:
theorem of_subsingleton {f : ℝ → ℝ} {X : Set ℝ} [Subsingleton X] : ConstantOn f X :=
  Constant.of_subsingleton

signature.pp: {f g : ℝ → ℝ} {X : Set ℝ} (h : ∀ x ∈ X, f x = g x) : constant_value_on f X = constant_value_on g X

ref.pp:
theorem constant_value_on_congr {f g : ℝ → ℝ} {X : Set ℝ} (h : ∀ x ∈ X, f x = g x) :
    constant_value_on f X = constant_value_on g X := by simp [constant_value_on]; congr; grind

signature.pp: (f : ℝ → ℝ) {I : BoundedInterval} (P : Partition I) : Prop

ref.pp:
/-- Definition 11.2.3 (Piecewise constant functions I) -/
abbrev PiecewiseConstantWith (f : ℝ → ℝ) {I : BoundedInterval} (P : Partition I) : Prop :=
  ∀ J ∈ P, ConstantOn f (J : Set ℝ)

signature.pp: (f : ℝ → ℝ) {I : BoundedInterval} {P : Partition I} : PiecewiseConstantWith f P ↔ ∀ J ∈ P, ∃ c, ∀ x ∈ J, f x = c

ref.pp:
theorem «def» (f : ℝ → ℝ) {I : BoundedInterval} {P : Partition I} :
    PiecewiseConstantWith f P ↔ ∀ J ∈ P, ∃ c, ∀ x ∈ J, f x = c := by
  simp [PiecewiseConstantWith, ConstantOn, Constant, mem_iff]

signature.pp:
{f g : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} {P : Partition I} (h : ∀ x ∈ (I : Set ℝ), f x = g x) :
  PiecewiseConstantWith f P ↔ PiecewiseConstantWith g P

ref.pp:
theorem congr {f g : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} {P : Partition I} (h : ∀ x ∈ (I : Set ℝ), f x = g x) :
    PiecewiseConstantWith f P ↔ PiecewiseConstantWith g P :=
  by
  simp [PiecewiseConstantWith]; peel with J hJ
  apply ConstantOn.congr; have := P.contains _ hJ; grind [subset_iff]

signature.pp: (f : ℝ → ℝ) (I : BoundedInterval) : Prop

ref.pp:
/-- Definition 11.2.5 (Piecewise constant functions I) -/
abbrev PiecewiseConstantOn (f : ℝ → ℝ) (I : BoundedInterval) : Prop :=
  ∃ P : Partition I, PiecewiseConstantWith f P

signature.pp: (f : ℝ → ℝ) (I : BoundedInterval) : PiecewiseConstantOn f I ↔ ∃ P : Partition I, ∀ J ∈ P, ConstantOn f (J : Set ℝ)

ref.pp:
theorem «def» (f : ℝ → ℝ) (I : BoundedInterval) :
    PiecewiseConstantOn f I ↔ ∃ P : Partition I, ∀ J ∈ P, ConstantOn f (J : Set ℝ) := by rfl

signature.pp:
{f g : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} (h : ∀ x ∈ (I : Set ℝ), f x = g x) :
  PiecewiseConstantOn f I ↔ PiecewiseConstantOn g I

ref.pp:
theorem congr {f g : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} (h : ∀ x ∈ (I : Set ℝ), f x = g x) :
    PiecewiseConstantOn f I ↔ PiecewiseConstantOn g I := by simp_rw [PiecewiseConstantOn, PiecewiseConstantWith.congr h]

signature.pp:
{f g : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} (hf : PiecewiseConstantOn f I) (h : ∀ x ∈ (I : Set ℝ), f x = g x) :
  PiecewiseConstantOn g I

ref.pp:
theorem congr' {f g : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} (hf : PiecewiseConstantOn f I) (h : ∀ x ∈ (I : Set ℝ), f x = g x) :
    PiecewiseConstantOn g I :=
  (congr h).mp hf

signature.pp: : ℝ → ℝ

ref.pp:
/-- Example 11.2.4 / Example 11.2.6 -/
noncomputable abbrev f_11_2_4 : ℝ → ℝ := fun x ↦
  if x < 1 then 0
  else -- junk value
    if x < 3 then 7
    else
      if x = 3 then 4
      else
        if x < 6 then 5
        else
          if x = 6 then 2
          else
            0 -- junk value

signature.pp: : PiecewiseConstantOn f_11_2_4 (Icc 1 6)

ref.pp:
example : PiecewiseConstantOn f_11_2_4 (Icc 1 6) :=
  by
  use Partition.mk {Ico 1 3, Icc 3 3, Ioo 3 6, Icc 6 6} ?_ ?_
  . sorry
  . sorry
  sorry

signature.pp: : PiecewiseConstantOn f_11_2_4 (Icc 1 6)

ref.pp:
example : PiecewiseConstantOn f_11_2_4 (Icc 1 6) :=
  by
  use Partition.mk {Ico 1 2, Icc 2 2, Ioo 2 3, Icc 3 3, Ioo 3 5, Ico 5 6, Icc 6 6} ?_ ?_
  . sorry
  . sorry
  sorry

ref.pp:
/-- Example 11.2.6 -/
theorem piecewiseConstantOn {f : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} (h : ConstantOn f (I : Set ℝ)) :
    PiecewiseConstantOn f I := by sorry

signature.pp:
{f : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} {P P' : Partition I} (hPP' : P ≤ P') (hP : PiecewiseConstantWith f P) :
  PiecewiseConstantWith f P'

ref.pp:
/-- Lemma 11.2.7 / Exercise 11.2.1 -/
theorem mono {f : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} {P P' : Partition I} (hPP' : P ≤ P') (hP : PiecewiseConstantWith f P) :
    PiecewiseConstantWith f P' := by sorry

signature.pp:
{f g : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} (hf : PiecewiseConstantOn f I) (hg : PiecewiseConstantOn g I) :
  PiecewiseConstantOn (f + g) I

ref.pp:
/-- Lemma 11.2.8 / Exercise 11.2.2 -/
theorem add {f g : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} (hf : PiecewiseConstantOn f I) (hg : PiecewiseConstantOn g I) :
    PiecewiseConstantOn (f + g) I := by sorry

signature.pp:
{f g : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} (hf : PiecewiseConstantOn f I) (hg : PiecewiseConstantOn g I) :
  PiecewiseConstantOn (f - g) I

ref.pp:
/-- Lemma 11.2.8 / Exercise 11.2.2 -/
theorem sub {f g : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} (hf : PiecewiseConstantOn f I) (hg : PiecewiseConstantOn g I) :
    PiecewiseConstantOn (f - g) I := by sorry

signature.pp:
{f g : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} (hf : PiecewiseConstantOn f I) (hg : PiecewiseConstantOn g I) :
  PiecewiseConstantOn (max f g) I

ref.pp:
/-- Lemma 11.2.8 / Exercise 11.2.2 -/
theorem max {f g : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} (hf : PiecewiseConstantOn f I) (hg : PiecewiseConstantOn g I) :
    PiecewiseConstantOn (max f g) I := by sorry

signature.pp:
{f g : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} (hf : PiecewiseConstantOn f I) (hg : PiecewiseConstantOn g I) :
  PiecewiseConstantOn (min f g) I

ref.pp:
/-- Lemma 11.2.8 / Exercise 11.2.2 -/
theorem min {f g : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} (hf : PiecewiseConstantOn f I) (hg : PiecewiseConstantOn g I) :
    PiecewiseConstantOn (min f g) I := by sorry

signature.pp:
{f g : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} (hf : PiecewiseConstantOn f I) (hg : PiecewiseConstantOn g I) :
  PiecewiseConstantOn (f * g) I

ref.pp:
/-- Lemma 11.2.8 / Exercise 11.2.2 -/
theorem mul {f g : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} (hf : PiecewiseConstantOn f I) (hg : PiecewiseConstantOn g I) :
    PiecewiseConstantOn (f * g) I := by sorry

signature.pp: {f : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} (c : ℝ) (hf : PiecewiseConstantOn f I) : PiecewiseConstantOn (c • f) I

ref.pp:
/-- Lemma 11.2.8 / Exercise 11.2.2 -/
theorem smul {f : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} (c : ℝ) (hf : PiecewiseConstantOn f I) : PiecewiseConstantOn (c • f) I :=
  by sorry

signature.pp:
{f g : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} (hf : PiecewiseConstantOn f I) (hg : PiecewiseConstantOn f I) :
  PiecewiseConstantOn (f / g) I

ref.pp:
/-- Lemma 11.2.8 / Exercise 11.2.2.  I believe the hypothesis that `g` does not vanish is not needed. -/
theorem div {f g : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} (hf : PiecewiseConstantOn f I) (hg : PiecewiseConstantOn f I) :
    PiecewiseConstantOn (f / g) I := by sorry

signature.pp: (f : ℝ → ℝ) {I : BoundedInterval} (P : Partition I) : ℝ

ref.pp:
/-- Definition 11.2.9 (Piecewise constant integral I)-/
noncomputable abbrev integ (f : ℝ → ℝ) {I : BoundedInterval} (P : Partition I) : ℝ :=
  ∑ J ∈ P.intervals, constant_value_on f (J : Set ℝ) * |J|ₗ

signature.pp: {f g : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} {P : Partition I} (h : ∀ x ∈ (I : Set ℝ), f x = g x) : integ f P = integ g P

ref.pp:
theorem integ_congr {f g : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} {P : Partition I} (h : ∀ x ∈ (I : Set ℝ), f x = g x) :
    integ f P = integ g P := by
  apply Finset.sum_congr rfl; intro J hJ; congr 1; apply constant_value_on_congr
  have := P.contains _ hJ; grind [subset_iff]

signature.pp: : ℝ → ℝ

ref.pp:
/-- Example 11.2.12 -/
noncomputable abbrev f_11_2_12 : ℝ → ℝ := fun x ↦ if x < 3 then 2 else if x = 3 then 4 else 6

signature.pp: : Partition (Icc 1 4)

ref.pp:
noncomputable abbrev P_11_2_12 : Partition (Icc 1 4) :=
  ((⊥ : Partition (Ico 1 3)).join (⊥ : Partition (Icc 3 3)) (join_Ico_Icc (by norm_num) (by norm_num))).join
    (⊥ : Partition (Ioc 3 4)) (join_Icc_Ioc (by norm_num) (by norm_num))

signature.pp: : PiecewiseConstantWith f_11_2_12 P_11_2_12

ref.pp: example : PiecewiseConstantWith f_11_2_12 P_11_2_12 := by sorry

signature.pp: : PiecewiseConstantWith.integ f_11_2_12 P_11_2_12 = 10

ref.pp: example : PiecewiseConstantWith.integ f_11_2_12 P_11_2_12 = 10 := by sorry

signature.pp: : Partition (Icc 1 4)

ref.pp:
noncomputable abbrev P_11_2_12' : Partition (Icc 1 4) :=
  ((((⊥ : Partition (Ico 1 2)).join (⊥ : Partition (Ico 2 3)) (join_Ico_Ico (by norm_num) (by norm_num))).join
          (⊥ : Partition (Icc 3 3)) (join_Ico_Icc (by norm_num) (by norm_num))).join
      (⊥ : Partition (Ioc 3 4)) (join_Icc_Ioc (by norm_num) (by norm_num))).add_empty

signature.pp: : PiecewiseConstantWith f_11_2_12 P_11_2_12'

ref.pp: example : PiecewiseConstantWith f_11_2_12 P_11_2_12' := by sorry

signature.pp: : PiecewiseConstantWith.integ f_11_2_12 P_11_2_12' = 10

ref.pp: example : PiecewiseConstantWith.integ f_11_2_12 P_11_2_12' = 10 := by sorry

signature.pp:
{f : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} {P P' : Partition I} (hP : PiecewiseConstantWith f P)
  (hP' : PiecewiseConstantWith f P') : integ f P = integ f P'

ref.pp:
/-- Proposition 11.2.13 (Piecewise constant integral is independent of partition) / Exercise 11.2.3 -/
theorem integ_eq {f : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} {P P' : Partition I} (hP : PiecewiseConstantWith f P)
    (hP' : PiecewiseConstantWith f P') : integ f P = integ f P' := by sorry

signature.pp: (f : ℝ → ℝ) (I : BoundedInterval) : ℝ

ref.pp:
/-- Definition 11.2.14 (Piecewise constant integral II)  -/
noncomputable abbrev integ (f : ℝ → ℝ) (I : BoundedInterval) : ℝ :=
  if h : PiecewiseConstantOn f I then PiecewiseConstantWith.integ f h.choose else 0

signature.pp: {f : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} (_ : PiecewiseConstantOn f I)

ref.pp:
noncomputable abbrev integ' {f : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} (_ : PiecewiseConstantOn f I) :=
  integ f I

signature.pp:
{f : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} {P : Partition I} (h : PiecewiseConstantWith f P) :
  integ f I = PiecewiseConstantWith.integ f P

ref.pp:
theorem integ_def {f : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} {P : Partition I} (h : PiecewiseConstantWith f P) :
    integ f I = PiecewiseConstantWith.integ f P :=
  by
  have h' : PiecewiseConstantOn f I := by use P
  simp [integ, h']; exact PiecewiseConstantWith.integ_eq h'.choose_spec h

signature.pp: {f g : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} (h : ∀ x ∈ (I : Set ℝ), f x = g x) : integ f I = integ g I

ref.pp:
theorem integ_congr {f g : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} (h : ∀ x ∈ (I : Set ℝ), f x = g x) : integ f I = integ g I :=
  by
  by_cases hf : PiecewiseConstantOn f I <;> (have hg := hf; rw [congr h] at hg; simp [integ, hf, hg])
  rw [PiecewiseConstantWith.integ_congr h, ← integ_def hg.choose_spec, ← integ_def]
  rw [← PiecewiseConstantWith.congr h]; exact hf.choose_spec

signature.pp: : PiecewiseConstantOn.integ f_11_2_4 (Icc 1 6) = 10

ref.pp:
/-- Example 11.2.15 -/
example : PiecewiseConstantOn.integ f_11_2_4 (Icc 1 6) = 10 := by sorry

signature.pp:
{f g : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} (hf : PiecewiseConstantOn f I) (hg : PiecewiseConstantOn g I) :
  integ (f + g) I = integ f I + integ g I

ref.pp:
/-- Theorem 11.2.16 (a) (Laws of integration) / Exercise 11.2.4 -/
theorem integ_add {f g : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} (hf : PiecewiseConstantOn f I) (hg : PiecewiseConstantOn g I) :
    integ (f + g) I = integ f I + integ g I := by sorry

signature.pp: {f : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} (c : ℝ) (hf : PiecewiseConstantOn f I) : integ (c • f) I = c * integ f I

ref.pp:
/-- Theorem 11.2.16 (b) (Laws of integration) / Exercise 11.2.4 -/
theorem integ_smul {f : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} (c : ℝ) (hf : PiecewiseConstantOn f I) :
    integ (c • f) I = c * integ f I := by sorry

signature.pp:
{f g : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} (hf : PiecewiseConstantOn f I) (hg : PiecewiseConstantOn g I) :
  integ (f - g) I = integ f I - integ g I

ref.pp:
/-- Theorem 11.2.16 (c) (Laws of integration) / Exercise 11.2.4 -/
theorem integ_sub {f g : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} (hf : PiecewiseConstantOn f I) (hg : PiecewiseConstantOn g I) :
    integ (f - g) I = integ f I - integ g I := by sorry

/-- Theorem 11.2.16 (d) (Laws of integration) / Exercise 11.2.4 -/
theorem integ_of_nonneg {f : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} (h : ∀ x ∈ I, 0 ≤ f x) (hf : PiecewiseConstantOn f I) :
    0 ≤ integ f I := by sorry

{f g : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} (h : ∀ x ∈ I, f x ≤ g x) (hf : PiecewiseConstantOn f I)
  (hg : PiecewiseConstantOn g I) : integ f I ≤ integ g I

ref.pp:
/-- Theorem 11.2.16 (e) (Laws of integration) / Exercise 11.2.4 -/
theorem integ_mono {f g : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} (h : ∀ x ∈ I, f x ≤ g x) (hf : PiecewiseConstantOn f I)
    (hg : PiecewiseConstantOn g I) : integ f I ≤ integ g I := by sorry

signature.pp: (c : ℝ) (I : BoundedInterval) : integ (fun _ ↦ c) I = c * |I|ₗ

ref.pp:
/-- Theorem 11.2.16 (f) (Laws of integration) / Exercise 11.2.4 -/
theorem integ_const (c : ℝ) (I : BoundedInterval) : integ (fun _ ↦ c) I = c * |I|ₗ := by sorry

signature.pp: {f : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} (h : ConstantOn f I) : integ f I = (constant_value_on f I) * |I|ₗ

ref.pp:
/-- Theorem 11.2.16 (f) (Laws of integration) / Exercise 11.2.4 -/
theorem integ_const' {f : ℝ → ℝ} {I : BoundedInterval} (h : ConstantOn f I) :

{I J : BoundedInterval} (hIJ : I ⊆ J) {f : ℝ → ℝ} (h : PiecewiseConstantOn f I) :
  PiecewiseConstantOn (fun x ↦ if x ∈ I then f x else 0) J

/-- Theorem 11.2.16 (g) (Laws of integration) / Exercise 11.2.4 -/
theorem of_extend {I J : BoundedInterval} (hIJ : I ⊆ J) {f : ℝ → ℝ} (h : PiecewiseConstantOn f I) :
    PiecewiseConstantOn (fun x ↦ if x ∈ I then f x else 0) J := by sorry

signature.pp:
{I J : BoundedInterval} (hIJ : I ⊆ J) {f : ℝ → ℝ} (h : PiecewiseConstantOn f I) :
  integ (fun x ↦ if x ∈ I then f x else 0) J = integ f I

/-- Theorem 11.2.16 (g) (Laws of integration) / Exercise 11.2.4 -/
theorem integ_of_extend {I J : BoundedInterval} (hIJ : I ⊆ J) {f : ℝ → ℝ} (h : PiecewiseConstantOn f I) :
    integ (fun x ↦ if x ∈ I then f x else 0) J = integ f I := by sorry

signature.pp:
{I J K : BoundedInterval} (hIJK : K.joins I J) (f : ℝ → ℝ) :
  PiecewiseConstantOn f K ↔ PiecewiseConstantOn f I ∧ PiecewiseConstantOn f J

ref.pp:
/-- Theorem 11.2.16 (h) (Laws of integration) / Exercise 11.2.4 -/
theorem of_join {I J K : BoundedInterval} (hIJK : K.joins I J) (f : ℝ → ℝ) :
    PiecewiseConstantOn f K ↔ PiecewiseConstantOn f I ∧ PiecewiseConstantOn f J := by sorry

{I J K : BoundedInterval} (hIJK : K.joins I J) {f : ℝ → ℝ} (h : PiecewiseConstantOn f K) :
  integ f K = integ f I + integ f J

ref.pp:
/-- Theorem 11.2.16 (h) (Laws of integration) / Exercise 11.2.4 -/
theorem integ_of_join {I J K : BoundedInterval} (hIJK : K.joins I J) {f : ℝ → ℝ} (h : PiecewiseConstantOn f K) :
    integ f K = integ f I + integ f J := by sorry
